DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine dual dispatch ambulance , fire fighter and/or police out-of-hospital cardiac arrest ( OHCA ) , reduce time cardiopulmonary resuscitation ( CPR ) defibrillation , thus increase survival .
DOC.brief_title: Survival Study After Out-of-hospital Cardiac Arrest
DOC.detailed_description: Hypothesis If simultaneous dispatch ambulance ( EMS ) , firefighter and/or police initiate OHCA occurs , two latter unit first scene , ambulance crew , â‰¥30 % case . We anticipate therefore overall 30-days survival increase national level 9 % 12 % . Method During period 110901 141231 OHCA case analyze emergency medical communication centre ( EMCC ) dispatch ambulance , firefighter and/or police . Participating Saving More Lives Sweden ( SAMS ) project follow county : Stockholm , Sodermanland , Jonkoping , Vastra Gotaland ( VG Region ) , Halland , Dalarna , Jamtland , Kalmar Uppsala . Data collect unit dispatch thereafter sent line database manage Registercentrum Gothenburg ( http : //www.registercentrum.se/ ) , administrator Swedish Cardiac Arrest Register . Parameters obtain : - Time dispatch fire fighter and/or police ( record digitally ) . - Time arrival patient . - Verification cardiac arrest . - CPR perform fire fighter police arrival EMS . - Automated External Defibrillator ( AED ) connect patient . - If yes , first record rhythm shockable , i.e . ventricular fibrillation ( VF ) pulseless ventricular tachycardia ( VT ) . - Time defibrillation . Survival data Swedish Cardiac Arrest Register ( SCAR ) obtain time period nine comparable Swedish region participate SAMS study .
DOC.criteria: All case dispatcher suspect cardiac arrest , i.e . unconscious person abnormal breathing Children < 8 Obviously deceased person accord regulation EMS protocol
